title: Sources: UCLA tells QBs of Iamaleava's transfer
content: The UCLA staff has informed the team's current quarterbacks of the expected transfer of Tennessee quarterback Nico Iamaleava to UCLA, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Sunday.

title: Acuna calls out Braves for not disciplining Kelenic
content: Ronald Acuna Jr. took to social media Sunday to criticize the way Braves manager Brian Snitker handled Jarred Kelenic being thrown out at second base after failing to hustle out of the batter's box on a long drive Saturday.

title: OKC sixth team to win playoff game by 50 points
content: Oklahoma City opened a 35-point lead in the first half of Game 1 vs. Memphis, the biggest first-half lead in any playoff Game 1 since at least 1996-97.

title: 'Shock and awe': U.S. women win hockey worlds
content: Tessa Janecke scored the winner as the United States prevailed in overtime over defending champion Canada 4-3 to win the women's ice hockey world championship Sunday.

title: Leicester relegated from PL after loss to Liverpool
content: Leicester City have been condemned to an immediate return to the Championship after their relegation from the Premier League was confirmed with a defeat to Liverpool on Sunday.

title: Marlins' Conine dislocates shoulder, out months
content: The Marlins have lost left fielder Griffin Conine for at least two months after he suffered a dislocated left shoulder during Saturday's game vs. the Phillies.

title: Rune stuns Alcaraz to win Barcelona Open title
content: Holger Rune defeated Carlos Alcaraz in the Barcelona Open final Sunday to lift his first title in two years.

title: Piastri beats Verstappen at Saudi Arabia GP
content: Oscar Piastri moved into the lead of the drivers' championship for the first time in his career after securing his third victory of the season at Sunday's Saudi Arabian Grand Prix.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Previewing Sunday's three Game 1s
content: Six teams begin their playoff journeys Sunday. Here's what to watch, plus Saturday's results and Three Stars.

title: Who’s the best player in the NFL draft? How about the 100th best? Legwold ranks them all
content: Jeff Legwold reveals his top prospect list, which is based purely on ability regardless of position. Who is No. 1?

title: 'How do we get better?' How Padres' October disappointment inspired 2025 success
content: The Padres were a win away from knocking out the Dodgers last year. Now, they're determined to come back even stronger -- even against the defending champs.

title: OU conquers '24 demons, reclaims gymnastics title
content: Fueled by last season's stunning early exit, Oklahoma reclaimed its place atop the college gymnastics world.

title: A win away from the title, Liverpool coronation begins at Leicester
content: Liverpool's fans were already celebrating the title in the win at Leicester. The team itself will soon join in.

title: Outfought and outclassed by Barcelona, Chelsea look cooked in Champions League semi
content: Chelsea will need to produce the best performance in their 33-year history to overturn a 4-1 defeat to Barcelona in the Women's Champions League.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: USWNT's Rodman out indefinitely with back injury
content: USWNT star Trinity Rodman has been ruled out indefinitely by the Washington Spirit as she continues to manage an ongoing back injury, the NWSL team confirmed to ESPN.

title: Barça net 'unbelievable' win, fear for Lewandowski
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick lauded Barcelona's "unbelievable" comeback against Celta Vigo as the "best feeling" after Raphinha's stoppage time penalty sealed a vital 4-3 win for the LaLiga leaders.

title: Inter Miami wins in front of record Crew crowd
content: Benjamin Cremaschi scored on a diving header in the 30th minute and Inter Miami beat the Columbus Crew 1-0 on Saturday.

title: Bundesliga history made with 8 goals in 1st half
content: Union Berlin and VfB Stuttgart made history on Saturday as the first Bundesliga game to feature eight goals before halftime.

title: Villa's Watkins: I was 'fuming' at PSG benching
content: Recalled Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins took out his anger on Newcastle United on Saturday with a dazzling display in his side's 4-1 victory in the Premier League.

title: Coach: Celta player target of racist slurs at Barça
content: Celta Vigo midfielder Ilaix Moriba was targeted by racist insults from Barcelona fans after their La Liga game on Saturday, his coach said.

title: Lyon strike late to edge Arsenal in UWCL semi
content: Kadi Diani and Melchie Dumornay handed Arsenal a rare defeat at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday as Lyon opened the Women's Champions League semifinal tie with a 2-1 win.

title: USMNT's Richards sent off in Palace draw
content: Bournemouth had to settle for a 0-0 draw against Crystal Palace in the Premier League at Selhurst Park on Saturday, with the hosts having been reduced to 10 men late in the first half after defender Chris Richards was sent off for a second yellow card.

title: What's on the masks of 2025 Stanley Cup playoff goalies? Our guide to all 16 teams
content: The 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs are underway and it's the drip in goal that could potentially steal the show.

title: The long fight ahead for boxing's Heather Hardy
content: The former boxing champ uses her brain injury to call for systemic changes to improve the health and education of fighters.

title: Former champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. is the right opponent for Jake Paul
content: Chavez's best day are in his rearview mirror, but this matchup is a big step up in competition for Paul.

title: Commute on OMR has been tough after Metro work began: motorists
content: They say though traffic moves without snarls thanks to U-turns introduced at various junctions the lack of space at certain portions of the road is a problem. Pedestrians are the worst hit, since footpaths have just vanished along the road

title: Physicist and teacher A.P. Balachandran passes away
content: He was the Joel Dorman Steele emeritus professor at Syracuse University and an internationally recognised theoretical physicist

title: New check dam, restored water channel across Palar near Katpadi inaugurated
content: According to the WRD officials, the entire channel has been desilted to a distance of 12.7 km and a depth of four metres, and widened up to three metres; the check dam has been built at ₹9.7 crore

title: MP, TDP leaders celebrate Naidu’s birthday in Vijayawada
content: People recognised the abilities of Chandrababu Naidu, and gave the TDP-Jana Sena Party-BJP alliance a resounding victory in the 2024 elections, says Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath

title: Team from T.N. participates in kite festival in Weifang, China
content: The event, recognised as the world’s prestigious kite festival, takes place in Weifang, Shandong Province, which is renowned as the ‘Kite Capital of the World’

title: Is nitrogen, the building block of life, a latent time-bomb?
content: Nitrous oxide is the third most abundant of the greenhouse gases; it accentuates the greenhouse effect in the same way as carbon dioxide does by capturing re-radiated infrared radiation from the Earth’s surface and warming the troposphere; urgent action on it is critical to achieving climate goals

title: Om Prakash’s wife called friend and claimed she killed him
content: A few days ago, Pallavi posted a series of messages on a WhatsApp group, claiming Om Prakash was trying to kill her and was drugging her daughter as well

title: Diving into SC’s verdict on Governors
content: The Supreme Court’s recent judgment in the Tamil Nadu Government’s suit against its Governor has done more than clear some Bills for the one State — it has set the tone for governments and Governors in a similar position in several other States

title: Doctor, hospital staffer sacked for dragging and assaulting a 77-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh government hospital
content: The man was accompanying his 70-year-old wife, a patient; hospital superintendent, who initially claimed the victim was “cutting the queue”, also suspended; FIR filed with charges of criminal intimidation

title: Arts and science colleges enter the arena of entrepreneurism
content: With the spread of start-up culture, colleges are improving their incubation cells and forging partnerships with the key players in the entrepreneurial ecosystem. As a result, more students pursuing arts and science courses are venturing into entrepreneurship

title: Historic representation of women in Civil Services: Union Minister Jitendra Singh
content: The Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) praises record women’s representation in IAS batch, with 74 women officers make up 41% of the 2023 batch of the Indian Administrative Service

title: Staff Selection Commission implements Aadhaar-based authentication for its recruitment exams
content: Aadhaar authentication aims to prevent identity fraud and ensure the integrity of the recruitment process for government jobs

title: Race for Dalit outreach intensifies in Uttar Pradesh
content: While the SP is pitching its PDA formula as a forum for Dalit upliftment against the ruling BJP, the BSP says the SP is the extreme casteist party

title: Murshidabad violence | Mamata is the ‘Durga of the RSS’, says West Bengal CPI(M) leader
content: CPI(M)‘s Md Salim blames the RSS for the conspiracy behind the Murshidabad riots and says the CM also wanted them to occur; this comes a day after the CM accused the RSS of a “vicious false campaign”

title: Nishikant Dubey slams former CEC Quraishi, calls him ‘Muslim commissioner’
content: His remarks come a day after the ruling party distanced itself from the MP’s comments against the Supreme Court and Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna

title: NCW stresses need for confidence-building measures in Murshidabad; Trinamool MPs visit violence-hit areas
content: The family of the father and son who were killed in the violence decline compensation from the State government

title: Report flags bovine risk to Vande Bharat trains; calls for safety measures
content: Railways told to identify regular trespassing locations/cattle ingress and devise suitable mechanism such as deployment of RPF personnel, regular patrolling and providing subway to facilitate farmers to cross over with cattle

title: BJP attempts to court an unlikely backward class and Dalit demographic ahead of 2026 Assembly polls
content: It has elevated 225 leaders from Other Backward Classes and 75 Dalit leaders to pivotal positions in the organisation’s district-level leadership ahead of the 2025 local body polls and the 2026 Assembly elections

title: On Thackeray brothers’ reunion talks, Sanjay Raut says ‘bond was never broken’
content: The Sena UBT MP says at present there is no alliance in place between Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray but only emotional talks that are going on

title: Over 500 works as part of pre-monsoon cleaning in capital
content: While city Corporation’s sanitation workers will take care of a good number of the drains, Minor and Major Irrigation departments will be handling most of the canals

title: Special health camps held after three deaths in Woraiyur
content: Water supply has been suspended in the area and water is being supplied to Ward Nos. 8 and 10 through tankers; a team of workers is trying identify the cause of contamination

title: Thiruvanaikoil residents exasperated with frequent disruption in power supply
content: Sources in TNPDC say there has been disruption in power supply ever since the collapse of two transmission towers on the Kollidam riverbed near Alagiripuram in Thiruvanaikoil a few months ago

title: India can be active player in developing international framework for responsible behaviour in space: EU envoy
content: Marjolijn van Deelen, European Union Special Envoy for Space, flags debris from Anti-Satellite weapon testing and Rendezvous and Proximity Operations (RPO) that threaten satellites as major concerns; cyber jamming and spoofing in space too are threats to delivering services to citizens, she says

title: To address demand of loco pilots, Railways fitting toilets in engines
content: Waterless urinal facilities provided in 883 locomotives since 2018, wherever feasible, says Ministry; 7,075 locos fitted with ACs; toilets being fitted in all new locos, older ones being retrofitted, says official

title: The unknown story of Peerumade’s first school in a tea estate bungalow
content: Said to have housed in the Penshurst Estate, a 150-year-old estate in Peerumade, there are no official records about the school or of the woman who began the school

title: Non-Muslim members in waqf boards is akin to reservations for them: Hyderabad MP
content: President of the All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen Asaduddin Owaisi points out that given the omission of the relevant section, in a scenario in which there arises a conflict between waqf laws and any other legislation, the latter would prevail

title: Cab shortage worsens at Bengaluru airport as BluSmart halts operations
content: Commuters left scrambling for alternatives amid limited other ride hailing cab availability in Bengaluru airport

title: Film industry should adopt Vincy’s stance of not working with those using drugs: M.B. Rajesh
content: Minister says no sector will be given any special consideration or exemption in the efforts to fully free Kerala from the influence of narcotic substances

title: Webinar for CA Aspirants to be held
content: Ramanathan Krishnan, senior programme convenor, Department of Commerce, Shiv Nadar University Chennai and Chella Krishna G., chartered accountant and partner, SRSV Associates, Chennai will speak at the webinar

title: Former senior official criticises Andhra Pradesh government for its plan to operate 10 medical colleges under PPP mode
content: Development is not about building roads, buying luxury cars or showing GDP figures, but it is about ensuring that people across the State live healthy lives, he says

title: 775 died in calamities, 95 in fire accidents in past two years in A.P.
content: APSDRF rescues 1,420 persons during the calamities, and the Fire Services Department officials save 29 people in fire fighting operations

title: Consumer welfare association pleads with govt. to reconstruct UPHC building in Nagapattinam
content: Although ₹1.2 crore was sanctioned under the National Health Mission for reconstruction of the buildingty, the work is yet to begin, says the association

title: Arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari opposes ED’s plea to declare him ‘fugitive’, calls his stay in U.K. legal
content: The High Court of Justice, London, U.K., in February allowed Bhandari’s appeal against his extradition to face charges of alleged tax evasion and money laundering. Bhandari claims his stay in the U.K. was legal since his extradition to India was denied by the London High Court.

title: Venugopal seeks action against BJP MP for ‘trying to intimidate Supreme Court’
content: He says open statements against judiciary will have serious consequences for democracy of our country

title: Congress-led Opposition alliance hits turbulence ahead of Assam panchayat polls
content: The grand old party reacts to Raijor Dal president and MLA Akhil Gogoi accusing MP Gaurav Gogoi and others of batting for the BJP

title: Education must reach the poor among all castes, says Siddaramaiah
content: Survey has produced empirical data that is essential to take up welfare and development programmes for all communities, says Chief Minister

title: Need for early diagnosis of kidney diseases stressed
content: Doctors talk of issues relating to kidney diseases at a transplant awareness event, where donors and survivors participated

title: Flash floods in Ramban: J&K CM Abdullah, L-G Sinha grieve rain-related deaths; assure relief, assistance to those affected
content: “My thoughts are with the affected families in this difficult hour. We are in touch with the local administration to ensure immediate rescue efforts wherever needed. Later today, I will be reviewing restoration, relief, and repair plans,” J&K CM Omar Abdullah said

title: Apollo Hospital, ‘fake’ cardiologist booked for MP, Chhattisgarh Assembly Speaker’s 2006 death
content: Yadav charged with criminal homicide for posing as a cardiologist, conducting cardiac procedures on former Speaker in 2006; Apollo Hospital management also booked for not checking his certificates

title: Counselling for rowdy-sheeters conducted in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: Police conducts cordon and search operations all over the district and vehicle-checks at Tadimarri, Kadiri Rural, and Dharmavaram station limits

title: Kerala Waqf Board to oppose Waqf Amendment Act before Supreme Court, State govt. yet to take a call
content: M.K. Sakeer says board has drawn up a statement detailing its stance and will file it before the apex court on Monday

title: Osmania University Arts College becomes the 3rd registered trademarked building in India
content: TThe university now holds exclusive rights over the use of the building’s image for any commercial purpose, protecting it from unauthorised replication and branding

title: Farmers continue to press for modernisation of  Thenperambur dam
content: Despite its significance, the dam continues to rely on manually operated shutters to regulate water flow — unlike modern structures such as Kallanai, where electrically operated actuators are in place

title: Telangana Fire Service Week 2025 concludes with a 5K run
content: The Fire Service Week campaign featured extensive outreach activities, including demonstrations, fire drills, training sessions, and educational lectures conducted across various types of premises, ranging from hospitals and industries to residential colonies and commercial establishments

title: She disappeared aged 12, returned at 22 to send her abuser to jail for life
content: A decade after being abducted and abused at age 12, a young woman's courageous testimony in a Chennai courtroom led to her abuser's conviction. Despite years of hiding, trauma, and disrupted schooling, she recounted her ordeal, resulting in a life sentence for the perpetrator.

title: Akshardham tour, dinner with PM Modi: What's on US VP JD Vance's agenda during India visit?
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, will visit India from April 18-24 to discuss economic and geopolitical priorities with Indian leaders. Prime Minister Modi will host Vance for talks, focusing on the India-US trade agreement. The visit includes stops in Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra, with Vance scheduled to speak at the Rajasthan International Centre.

title: ATS probes use of Signal app to spread anti-national propaganda, FIR registered
content: The Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) has filed an FIR and initiated an investigation into an inter-state module allegedly using encrypted platforms to spread anti-national content and radicalize youth for suicide attacks. The group, active on platforms like Signal and WhatsApp, promoted jihad, encouraged attacks on Indian security forces, and discussed targeting Hindu leaders and Israeli establishments.

title: IPL: Rohit Sharma goes beast mode as MI humble Dhoni's CSK
content: Rohit Sharma silenced critics with a blistering, unbeaten 76, his highest IPL 2025 score, propelling Mumbai Indians to a dominant nine-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings. Coming in as an Impact Substitute, Sharma partnered with Suryakumar Yadav for a match-winning 114-run stand. Jasprit Bumrah's bowling earlier restricted CSK, setting the stage for MI's triumphant chase.

title: 'Muslim Commissioner': Amid SC row, BJP's Dubey targets poll panel ex-chief
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey targeted former chief election commissioner S Y Quraishi, calling him a 'Muslim commissioner', following criticism of the Waqf (Amendment) Act. Dubey him of facilitating Bangladeshi infiltrators' voter registration. This incident follows Dubey's controversial remarks about the Supreme Court and CJI, leading the BJP to distance itself from his statements questioning the court's authority.

title: George Soros' son wishes Happy Easter, Elon Musk responds: You ...
content: A brief exchange on X between Alex Soros and Elon Musk has sparked intrigue, given their families' history of public disagreements. It began when Alex Soros shared Easter greetings, to which Musk responded with, “Um … you too”.

title: New Record! Rohit creates history in IPL, becomes first Indian to...
content: Rohit Sharma etched his name in IPL history by becoming the first Indian cricketer to win 20 Player of the Match awards, achieving this milestone during Mumbai Indians' dominant victory over Chennai Super Kings. Sharma's unbeaten 76, along with Suryakumar Yadav's explosive 68, powered MI to a comfortable win. This achievement underscores Sharma's enduring impact and consistency in the IPL.

title: Karnataka ex-top cop found 'murdered' at home, 'wife prime suspect'
content: Former Karnataka DGP and IGP, Om Prakash, was found murdered at his Bengaluru residence on Sunday evening. Police Commissioner B Dayananda confirmed the death, stating Prakash was discovered in a pool of blood. His wife is the primary suspect, with initial reports suggesting stab wounds.

title: Watch: Shreyas Iyer pissed after Virat Kohli's wild celebrations
content: Virat Kohli's unbeaten 73 propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a dominant victory over Punjab Kings in IPL 2025, maintaining their unblemished away record. RCB chased down the 157-run target with ease, winning by 7 wickets. Post-match, Kohli's playful teasing of PBKS captain Shreyas Iyer sparked a frosty exchange.

title: Why Tesla CEO Elon Musk just got loads of flowers delivered to Mumbai
content: Maye Musk, Elon Musk's mother, celebrated her 77th birthday in Mumbai, receiving beautiful flowers from her son. She expressed her gratitude on Twitter, sharing photos of the bouquets. Earlier, both Elon and Maye exchanged affectionate messages on the platform.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli caught bullying bowler on stump mic
content: Virat Kohli's fiery spirit was evident during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory over Punjab Kings, highlighted by a verbal exchange with spinner Harpreet Brar. Kohli's remark, caught on the stump mic, quickly went viral, sparking debate among fans. His unbeaten 73, coupled with Devdutt Padikkal's 61, secured the win, leveling Bengaluru with Punjab in the standings.

title: 'I’m here to help': Donald Trump gets praise from Mark Cuban for healthcare order
content: Mark Cuban has voiced his support for Donald Trump's healthcare executive order, deeming it a potentially transformative move for the nation. The billionaire believes the drug pricing reforms could yield substantial savings by curbing the influence of pharmacy benefit managers. Cuban advocates for data transparency, independent formulary management, and the protection of independent pharmacies.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder told employees: 'Go home, have dinner with family ...'
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: Rift between King Charles & William? Why Prince & Kate skipped Easter celebrations
content: Prince William and Princess Kate, along with their children, opted out of the Royal Easter celebrations for the second consecutive year, choosing to spend quality family time at Anmer Hall in Norfolk. A source close to the royal family clarified that the decision was made to prioritize family time before the children's return to school.

title: OKC make a big statement and what's next for the Wolves, Lakers, and Nuggets
content: the 2024-25 playoffs are underway, and our NBA insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . all season long, the Western Conference standings were in constant flux . the no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets rallied to an overtime win over the 5-seed LA Clippers to take Game 1 .

title: 'Breach of orders': Israel accepts 'failure' in Gaza medics' killing
content: An Israeli military investigation revealed that the killing of 15 emergency responders in Gaza on March 23 was due to an “operational misunderstanding” and breaches of protocol. Troops mistakenly perceived a threat, leading to the tragic incident in Rafah's Tal al-Sultan area. Disciplinary actions include the dismissal of a battalion commander and reprimand for a brigade commander.

title: 'They just fled out of fear': TMC MLA denies reports of vandalism in Murshidabad
content: TMC leaders in Murshidabad deny reports of vandalism, claiming displaced families willingly returned home after fleeing out of fear following violence linked to protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: Watch: Kohli lashes out at Patidar in heated mid-pitch mix-up
content: Virat Kohli's aggressive demeanor was evident during RCB's victory over Punjab Kings, highlighted by a heated on-field exchange with Rajat Patidar after a near run-out. Kohli, visibly frustrated, yelled at Patidar, though tensions eased quickly. Kohli's unbeaten 73, along with Devdutt Padikkal's 61, anchored RCB's chase of 158, while Krunal Pandya and Suyash Sharma starred with the ball, restricting PBKS.

title: Easter Parade 2025 takes over NYC: How to watch colourful celebrations
content: Easter Sunday 2025 sees New York City's Fifth Avenue transformed by the annual Easter Parade and Bonnet Festival. Starting at 10 am near St. Patrick's Cathedral, the parade showcases elaborate bonnets and costumes as participants stroll up Fifth Avenue.

title: 'Order issued in middle of night': Judge's dissent note on blocking deportations
content: Justice Samuel Alito dissented sharply after the Supreme Court temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deporting Venezuelans. Alito criticized the court's overnight intervention as unprecedented and legally questionable, citing insufficient explanation and dubious factual support. He noted the court acted without hearing the government's side or allowing lower courts to rule.

title: Who is Ayush Mhatre, youngest to play for CSK?
content: Chennai Super Kings surprised everyone by debuting 17-year-old Ayush Mhatre, making him the youngest player in franchise history. Replacing the injured Ruturaj Gaikwad, Mhatre impressed in his debut against Mumbai Indians, showcasing his talent after being scouted during mid-season trials. His fearless approach and quickfire 22 off 7 balls have made him a player to watch.

title: Taylor Swift gets called out for using private jet amid Perry’s space trip
content: Taylor Swift faces criticism for her carbon footprint after a fan account seemingly defended her private jet use by referencing Katy Perry's involvement in Blue Origin's space trip. Fans argue that both activities contribute to environmental damage, regardless of scale. This surfaces amidst Kanye West controversy, where Swift has taken legal action following his explicit social media posts about her.

title: India likely to explore 'early tranche' in US trade deal
content: Indian trade negotiators are heading to Washington D.C. to explore an "early tranche" deal, potentially addressing a limited set of issues to expedite negotiations with the U.S. Both countries aim to finalize the agreement quickly, possibly before the fall deadline, while navigating regulatory hurdles like digital tax and reciprocal tariffs. Clarity is expected during U.S.

title: Why Rohit Sharma not selected in MI playing XI
content: Rohit Sharma, despite a recent slump in form and a nagging knee injury, was benched for Mumbai Indians' match against Chennai Super Kings, potentially to be used as an Impact Substitute. After being felicitated for his 18th IPL season, Rohit's role is crucial for MI's comeback, especially with their current position outside the top four.

title: 'Throw my ashes ...': UP techie accuses wife of harassment, dies by suicide
content: Mohit Yadav, a 33-year-old techie from Uttar Pradesh, tragically died by suicide, alleging mental harassment by his wife and her family. In a video message, Yadav cited the lack of legal protection for men and accused his wife of demanding his property and forcing an abortion.

title: Uddhav & Raj Thackeray reunion on the cards? What BJP, Cong & NCP said
content: After two decades of estrangement, Uddhav and Raj Thackeray have hinted at a possible reconciliation, prioritizing Maharashtra's interests. Uddhav expressed his readiness to unite, while Raj emphasized that their differences are detrimental to the state and Marathi people. This potential reunion has garnered mixed reactions, with some welcoming it and others expressing skepticism about its impact.

title: Virat Kohli breaks record for most fifty-plus scores in IPL history
content: Virat Kohli's unbeaten 73 against Punjab Kings propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a comfortable seven-wicket victory. Kohli surpassed David Warner to claim the record for most fifty-plus scores in IPL history, reaching his 67th. Devdutt Padikkal's explosive 61 complemented Kohli's anchor innings, while disciplined bowling from Krunal Pandya and Suyash Sharma restricted Punjab Kings to a manageable total.

title: Gurdwara in Canada vandalised with pro-Khalistan graffiti
content: A Gurdwara in Vancouver was vandalized with pro-Khalistan graffiti, prompting an investigation by authorities. The Khalsa Diwan Society attributed the act to Sikh separatists, denouncing it as an attempt to sow division within the Canadian Sikh community. This incident follows a series of vandalisms targeting religious structures in Canada, including Hindu temples, raising concerns about rising extremism.

title: IPL: Virat Kohli leads with 73* as clinical RCB crush Punjab Kings
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Punjab Kings by seven wickets. RCB bowlers restricted Punjab to 157. Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 73. Devdutt Padikkal contributed a dazzling 61. Their 103-run partnership secured the victory. RCB has now won five away games. The team climbed to third place on the points table. It was a dominant performance by RCB.

title: Watch: RJ Mahvash caught clapping after Chahal smashed for 6
content: RJ Mahvash's enthusiastic applause for Devdutt Padikkal's six off Yuzvendra Chahal during an RCB innings has ignited social media. This reaction, captured on camera, adds fuel to the ongoing speculation about Mahvash and Chahal's relationship, especially considering her frequent support for Punjab Kings.

title: In Easter greetings, Trump rants against Biden & 'Left lunatics'
content: In his Easter message, Donald Trump criticized the 'Radical Left Lunatics,' 'weak' judges, and 'sleepy' Joe Biden. He accused the left of endangering the country by supporting criminals and slammed Biden's open border policy as a calamitous act. Trump also reiterated claims of a rigged 2020 election, wishing a sarcastic 'Happy Easter' to his political adversaries.

title: 'Yaha holiday manane aate hai': Sehwag slams IPL foreigners
content: Virender Sehwag has criticised Glenn Maxwell and Liam Livingstone for their lacklustre performances in IPL 2024, suggesting they lack the hunger to contribute meaningfully. Maxwell's poor batting form and Livingstone's inconsistency haven't justified their high price tags. Sehwag questions their commitment, implying they treat the IPL as a mere holiday, failing to deliver the expected impact for their respective teams.

title: Viral video: Preity Zinta spotted chatting with Rajeev Shukla
content: During an IPL match, Preity Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, was seen in an engaging conversation with BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla, sparking social media buzz. While their discussion added intrigue off the field, the Punjab Kings struggled on the pitch, facing a batting collapse despite a promising start, ultimately managing only 157 for six.

title: 'Did he seek wife's permission?': Rane mocks Uddhav amid reunion rumours
content: Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane has ignited political speculation by asking Uddhav Thackeray if he took "his wife Rashmi Thackeray's permission" for a potential alliance with MNS chief Raj Thackeray. This comes amid hints from both Thackeray cousins about a possible reunion after 20 years, prioritising Maharashtra's interests. While Sanjay Raut acknowledges ongoing "emotional talks."

title: South African cheetahs Prabhash and Pavak relocated from MP's Kuno
content: Two South African cheetahs, Prabhash and Pavak, were released into Madhya Pradesh's Gandhi Sagar Sanctuary by Chief Minister Mohan Yadav on Sunday. The six-year-old males were originally translocated to Kuno National Park in February 2023. This relocation is part of Prime Minister Modi's initiative to reintroduce cheetahs to Asia. Kuno National Park currently houses 24 cheetahs, including 14 India-born cubs.

title: Yogi as PM?: Akhilesh Yadav's big claim on BJP plot for Maha Kumbh
content: Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP of plotting to use the Maha Kumbh to promote Yogi Adityanath as a Prime Ministerial candidate and fostering societal division. This accusation follows BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's controversial remarks criticizing the Supreme Court, which the BJP has distanced itself from, emphasizing they were Dubey's personal views.

title: Renovation begins at Mannat, KL shares glimpse of bday celebrations: Top 5 news
content: Shah Rukh Khan's Mannat undergoes renovation, drawing fans. Rohit Shetty revealed Deepika Padukone's pregnancy during 'Singham Again' filming. Shaheen Bhatt's Instagram post sparked relationship rumors with Ishaan Mehra. Vikas Khanna defended Gauri Khan's restaurant against paneer allegations. Khushboo Patani rescued an abandoned baby girl, earning widespread praise for her courageous act in Bareilly.

title: Alien remains? Nasa's Perseverance rover spots skull-shaped structure on Mars
content: Nasa's Perseverance rover discovered a skull-shaped rock, dubbed "Skull Hill," in Mars' Jezero Crater, standing out against the lighter terrain. Chemical analysis ruled out meteorite composition, suggesting it might be an igneous rock transported by natural forces. Further tests are planned to determine its origin and age, leveraging the rover's analytical capabilities.

title: 'One temple, one cremation ground': RSS chief's call for social unity
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasized social unity, advocating for shared resources and values to build a strong Hindu society. He urged members to engage with all communities to foster harmony. Meanwhile, Congress criticized the RSS and BJP, accusing them of dividing society and conspiring against marginalized groups through legislation like the Waqf Amendment Act.

title: Tripura Sends Team To India-Bangladesh Border Amid Concerns Over Embankments
content: A high-level delegation on Sunday visited the border town of Belonia and conducted an on the spot study, and possible effects on the Indian side due to an embankment being constructed by the Bangladesh government along the Muhuri River.

title: "Objectives Achieved?": Manipur Congress MP On Ceasefire With Kuki-Zo Militants
content: Manipur Congress MP A Bimol Akoijam has questioned whether a controversial tripartite agreement between two dozen Kuki-Zo militant groups and the Centre and the state government "has become the reason of conflicts" in Manipur.

title: 'Khalistani Elements Planning My Assassination': Union Minister
content: Union Minister Ravneet Singh Bittu on Sunday alleged that some pro-Khalistan elements linked to 'Waris Punjab De' outfit--whose chief is radical preacher Amritpal Singh--were plotting to assassinate him and other political leaders in Punjab.

title: Mumbai Woman Harassed By Shirtless Man During Auto Rickshaw Ride In Mumbai
content: A shirtless man who appeared to be mentally unstable harassed a female passenger during her drive back home in an autorickshaw in Bandra area of Mumbai.

title: Mumbai Court Judge's iPhone Stolen During IPL Match At Wankhede Stadium
content: An iPhone of a Chief Judicial Magistrate was stolen at the Wankhede Stadium where he had gone to watch an IPL (Indian Premier League) match, police said on Sunday.

title: Vehicles In Delhi That Don't Display Colour-Coded Fuel Stickers To Be Penalised
content: The Delhi transport department is set to crack down on vehicles that do not display colour-coded stickers indicating their fuel type, officials said on Sunday.

title: Jharkhand Chief Minister Visits Sagrada Familia In Barcelona
content: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren visited the iconic Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, accompanied by a delegation.

title: Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport, 1 Runway Working, Other Under Repair
content: Flight operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport faced delays today after the authorities shut one runway for repairs.

title: "You Were Muslim Commissioner": BJP MP Attacks Ex Poll Body Chief SY Quraishi
content: After causing an uproar with his remarks against the Chief Justice of India, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey on Sunday fired a salvo at SY Quraishi, saying he was not an election commissioner but a "Muslim commissioner".

title: 'Fake' Doctor Charged Over Death Of Chhattisgarh Ex-Speaker
content: 'Fake' cardiologist Narendra Yadav alias Narendra John Camm and a Bilaspur hospital have been booked for culpable homicide over the death of former assembly speaker Rajendra Prasad Shukla 19 years ago, an official said on Sunday.

title: Actor Disha Patani's Sister Climbs Wall To Save Baby In Abandoned Building
content: An abandoned infant, about nine to 10 months old, was rescued from a dilapidated structure by Bollywood actress Disha Patani's sister, Khushboo Patani here on Sunday morning, police said.

title: After Omar Abdullah's "S*** Show" Post, Delhi Airport's Response
content: Delhi airport has responded to Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's criticism of the facility as a "bloody s*** show" with some technical facts.

title: "Government Of Words, Not Action": BRS Leader K Kavitha Targets Revanth Reddy
content: BRS leader K Kavitha, daughter of former chief minister KCR, strongly criticized the Congress in Telangana for running a "government of mere words, not action", and claimed that the people of the state are rapidly losing faith in its leadership.

title: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap Faces Case In Jaipur Over His 'Brahmin' Remarks
content: An FIR was registered against film director Anurag Kashyap at Bajaj Nagar police station here for his remarks on Brahmins on a social media platform, an officer said on Sunday.

title: Trump Slams "Weak, Ineffective" Judges As Deportation Row Intensifies
content: The clash over President Donald Trump's bid to exercise unprecedented powers in deporting migrants deepened Sunday as he again bashed the judiciary, while a top Democrat warned the country was "closer and closer" to a constitutional crisis.

title: "What A Debut": Sundar Pichai's Shout-Out To Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: An audacious first-ball six by a 14-year-old, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, on his Indian Premier League (IPL) debut earned him huge praise all around. One among those admirers was Sundar Pichai, the chief executive of tech giant Google.

title: Fredricson the only bright spot on another dismal day for Man United
content: despite a 1-0 defeat to Wolves, the premier league has become little more than an after-thought for Manchester United . despite the grueling 120 minutes against Lyon on friday, amorim handed a first senior appearance against Wolves to young defender Tyler Fredricson . the 20-year-old's injuries and rotation presented him with an unexpected opportunity .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs first-round guide: Best bets and Conn Smythe predictions
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs begin on saturday with 16 teams looking to etch their name onto Lord Stanley's Cup . the Winnipeg Jets look to make their first Stanley Cup Final appearance . they will face the los Angeles Kings for the fourth straight postseason .

title: Israel Army Probe Says No "Indiscriminate Fire" In Killing Of Gaza Medics
content: An Israeli military investigation concluded Sunday that its troops did not use "indiscriminate fire" in an incident that killed 15 Gaza emergency service personnel, but acknowledged failures and announced plans to dismiss a field commander.

title: Liberals Vs Conservatives: Where Things Stand In Canada Polls 2025
content: With the 2025 Canada elections around the corner, Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberal Party continues to maintain a lead in voting intentions over rival Conservatives led by Pierre Poilievre.

title: Samajwadi Party To Fight 2027 UP Polls With INDIA Bloc? Akhilesh Yadav Says...
content: Mr Yadav said that the "PDA (Backward, Dalits, and Minorities) would uproot the BJP" from the state in the 2027 assembly elections.
